Article Title: Gemini for Google Workspace gets an update: What‚Äôs changing, who‚Äôs impacted and more
Article Text:
What it means for users

Google Workspace extensions for Gmail , Google Drive and Google Docs are now available in open beta for Gemini (gemini.google.com), the company has announced. These will be accessible for Gemini for Google Workspace add-on subscribers.‚ÄúGoogle Workspace admins can now opt-in to beta test Gemini Extensions for Gmail and Drive for their organisation. Via the Drive extension, organisations can also access information from Google Docs,‚Äù the company said in an announcement.This means that when enabled, Gemini will be able to cross reference, or to pull data from, these apps as sources to provide contextual information in its responses.Those subscribers who will be using this capability will be able to find and summarise information, as well as ground Gemini‚Äôs responses, from their own content.‚ÄúNow, Google Workspace users can collaborate with information from select Google Workspace apps, all in one place, bringing Gemini‚Äôs capabilities into user‚Äôs daily workflows, enhancing productivity and collaboration,‚Äù it added.For example, you can ask Gemini to pull a specific data sheet (Google Doc) from Drive, analyse it, and send an email to your colleague after summarising the data.The company says that Google Workspace data will not be used to train Gemini‚Äôs public model, and admins have the capability to disable access at any time. This feature will be OFF by default and can be enabled at the OU or Group level.Full rollout for Rapid Release and Scheduled Release domains has been started. It will be available for Google Workspace customers with the Gemini Business, Enterprise, Education, or Education Premium add-on.
Article Summary: Gemini extensions for Gmail, Drive and Google Docs are now available in open beta. These will be accessible for Gemini for Google Workspace add-on subscribers. Article Title: OpenAI has trained AI models to produce text that humans can easily understand, here‚Äôs how
Article Text:
How OpenAI found a solution to this problem

Tech companies like Google and ChatGPT maker OpenAI are pushing innovation to enhance the output provided by chatbots . By harnessing the power of AI, machine learning and advanced data analytics, they are optimising language models to improve the responses. In one such case, OpenAI has reported a breakthrough in which the company trained strong language models to produce text that is easy for weak language models to verify.The Microsoft-backed company found that this training also made the text easier for humans to evaluate.‚ÄúMaking sure that language models produce understandable text is crucial to making them helpful for people, especially when dealing with complex tasks like solving math problems,‚Äù OpenAI said in a blog this week.The company said that it found that despite its AI models spitting out factually correct answers, they were harder to understand.‚ÄúWhen we asked human evaluators with limited time to assess these highly optimised solutions, they made nearly twice as many errors compared to when they evaluated less optimised solutions. This finding highlights the importance of not just correctness, but also clarity and ease of verification in AI-generated text,‚Äù it added.OpenAI trained advanced language models to create text that weaker models can easily verify, which humans could also evaluate more effectively ‚Äì a process called improving legibility. The company deployed a ‚Äòprover-verifier game‚Äô wherein two players: a "prover" that generates a solution and a "verifier" that checks it for accuracy.‚ÄúTo improve legibility, we optimise chain-of-thoughts on grade-school math problems to be verifiable by weaker models and study whether this makes them more legible to humans. This training procedure is inspired by the Prover-Verifier Game, a game-theoretic framework to encourage learning agents to solve decision problems in a verifiable manner,‚Äù OpenAI said.OpenAI says it used a training scheme in which a strong model produced solutions that a much weaker model, the verifier, can easily verify ‚Äì large and small models from the GPT-4 family.
Article Summary: OpenAI trained language models to produce text that weaker models can easily verify. Microsoft-backed company found that this training also made the text easier for humans to evaluate. The company deployed a ‚Äòprover-verifier game‚Äô wherein two players: a "prover" that generates a solution and a "verifier" that checks it for accuracy.

Article Title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella shares 'update' on Windows outage
Article Text:
Microsoft‚Äôs Windows devices, Microsoft 365, and Azure affected

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has acknowledged a widespread Windows outage affecting IT systems globally, stemming from a problematic update released by cybersecurity provider CrowdStrike . The incident has caused significant disruptions across various sectors, including airlines, banks, and emergency services."We are aware of this issue and are working closely with CrowdStrike and across the industry to provide customers technical guidance and support to safely bring their systems back online," Nadella stated on social media platform X (formerly Twitter).The outage, which began yesterday, has resulted in countless Windows PCs and servers encountering the " Blue Screen of Death " (BSOD), effectively rendering them inoperable. This has triggered a domino effect, placing extraordinary strain on Microsoft's data centres and network infrastructure, subsequently affecting Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 services.CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz clarified that the incident was not a security breach or cyberattack. "Today was not a security or cyber incident. Our customers remain fully protected," Kurtz said. He added, "We understand the gravity of the situation and are deeply sorry for the inconvenience and disruption."The faulty update has impacted a wide range of critical services globally. Airlines have reported grounded flights, banks are experiencing service interruptions, and even 911 emergency services in several US states have been compromised.While CrowdStrike has identified the issue and deployed a fix, recovery is expected to be a gradual process. IT administrators face the challenging task of manually resetting affected machines, a process that could take days or even weeks for large organisations.
Article Summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has acknowledged a widespread Windows outage affecting IT systems globally. The incident has caused significant disruptions across various sectors, including airlines, banks, and emergency services. Article Title: Microsoft cuts jobs in DEI team; laid-off employee sends email
Article Text: Microsoft has eliminated its internal team focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), citing "changing business needs," according to a recent report by Business Insider.The layoffs , which took effect on July 1, have sparked controversy within the tech company.The move comes despite Microsoft's previous commitments to improve diversity efforts, including a pledge made in 2020 to double the number of Black and African-American leaders within the company by 2025.The current progress on this initiative remains unclear.However, a leader of the disbanded team has expressed strong criticism of the decision in an email sent to thousands of Microsoft employees, as he suggests that the team is no longer critical for the company. "True systems-change work associated with DEI programs everywhere are no longer business critical or smart as they were in 2020," the team leader wrote, as reported by Business Insider.Microsoft spokesperson Jeff Jones stated that the company's diversity and inclusion commitments remain unchanged. "Our focus on diversity and inclusion is unwavering and we are holding firm on our expectations, prioritising accountability, and continuing to focus on this work," Jones said in a statement to Business Insider.This reduction in DEI staff aligns with a broader trend in the tech industry. Companies like Zoom , Google , and Meta have also reportedly cut back on their diversity programs in recent months.The layoffs are part of Microsoft's annual workforce adjustments, which typically occur around the start of its fiscal year. However, the company has been conducting more frequent rounds of job cuts recently, including a significant reduction of 10,000 employees announced in early 2023.
Article Summary: Microsoft has eliminated its internal team focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) The layoffs took effect on July 1, and have sparked controversy within the tech company. A leader of the disbanded team expressed strong criticism of the decision in an email sent to thousands of Microsoft employees.

Article Text: Tata Consultancy Services ( TCS ) recently reported a close to 70% of employees returning to office after the company linked variable pay to attendance. In an interview with Money Control, chief executive officer (CEO) C Vijayakumar said that the company has ‚Äúno such plans to link variable compensation with bringing people to office‚Äù.‚ÄúReturn to office continues to increase, and it varies from business line to business line.Some business lines, we're able to comfortably work remotely. And for some business lines, we think getting people back to work is the right strategy. We don't have any such plans to link variable compensation with bringing people to office,‚Äù Vijayakumar said.The report also quotes HCLTech chief people officer Ramachandran Sundararajan who said during the company‚Äôs Q1 earnings conference on July 12 that variable pay is not a big cost for the IT company. ‚ÄúThe quarterly variable pay is only applicable for the junior level employees and not the mid and senior levels. And there is no significant shift in that decision, it‚Äôs the same quarter on quarter,‚Äù Sundararajan then said.HCL Tech CEO dismisses fears of technology insourcing eating into the share of Indian software exporterStating that such insourcing is limited to mostly large captive players and few conglomerates, Vijayakumar told Economic Times, ‚ÄúI don't think it's across the board. Article Title: How Amazon‚Äôs ‚Äòdirty diapers mistake‚Äô killed this multi-million dollar family business
Article Text:
‚ÄòDamaging review‚Äô stayed for years

What Amazon said

A small family business selling washable swim diapers on Amazon was ruined after the e-commerce giant resold a used, faeces-stained diaper to a customer, according to a report from Bloomberg.Paul and Rachelle Baron , owners of Beau & Belle Littles, say their once-thriving company has been devastated by a single one-star review left in 2020. The customer received a diaper "covered in poop stains" that Amazon had apparently failed to inspect before reselling as new.The review, which included photos of the soiled diaper, quickly gained traction as other shoppers marked it "helpful." This boosted its visibility in the e-commerce platform's algorithm, overshadowing hundreds of positive reviews."The last four years have been an emotional train wreck," Paul Baron told Bloomberg. The couple says they are now $600,000 in debt, barely making enough to pay down loans and order inventory.Amazon's policy requires inspection of all returned items before resale. However, consultants told Bloomberg that selling used products as new is a growing problem on the platform. The sheer volume of returns makes thorough inspection difficult, according to a former Amazon employee.Despite repeated pleas from the Barons, Amazon reportedly refused to remove the damaging review for years. The company finally took it down hours after Bloomberg published its report on Monday.In a statement to Bloomberg, Amazon spokesperson Chris Oster said they have since improved their returns process and updated policies to prevent resale of certain returned products. He called such incidents "extremely rare."While Amazon‚Äôs marketplace provides small businesses access to millions of customers, the case highlights that sellers have little recourse when things go wrong. Some critics say Amazon's algorithms and review system can amplify isolated incidents, potentially ruining businesses over a single mistake.For the Barons, who once appeared on national television as an Amazon success story, the damage has already been done. They are now seeking additional work to make ends meet."Amazon talks a big game about helping small businesses," Paul Baron said. "But they really don't."
Article Summary: Beau & Belle Littles, a small business selling washable swim diapers, was ruined by a single one-star review left in 2020. The customer received a diaper "covered in poop stains" that Amazon had apparently failed to inspect before reselling as new. Amazon's policy requires inspection of all returned items before resale.

Article Title: Why Lucknow SuperGiants 'shared' this Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma photo with Elon Musk
Article Text:
What Virat Kohli told PM Modi

Lucknow SuperGiants official X, formerly Twitter, account recently replied to a post from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a post on X, Musk asked users to share beautiful content. Lucknow Super Giant's social media account replied to the same with a picture from the recent ICC T20 World Cup final, which was played between Indian and South Africa. The Indian team beat South Africa by 7-run to win the World Cup, which ended India's 13-year-long wait for an ICC World Cup trophy."Would be lovely to see more accounts on ùïè simply posting beautiful content x.com/evalovesdesign‚Ä¶," wrote Musk.Quoting this Elon Musk post, Lucknow SuperGiants replied, "Okay done ü•∞," and along with these words shared the picture of Indian cricket team captain Rohit Sharma hugging star batsman Virat Kohli .These pictures of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma hugging are said to have broken the internet. The pictures shared on various social media platforms including X, Instagram and Facebook have got millions of likes.Talking about the hug at the felicitation ceremony, Kohli said "We have been playing for the last 15 years, this is the first time, I see Rohit so emotional - he was crying, I was crying, a hug between both of us - I will never forget that day." He added that he had instantly realised that it was time for him to say goodbye to the format and make way for youngsters.During the Indian team's interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi at his residence on July 4, Kohli said, "We lived each ball at the end, we can't explain what was going on inside. Article Summary: Lucknow SuperGiants official X, formerly Twitter, account recently replied to a post from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk. In a post on X, Musk asked users to share beautiful content. Lucknow Super Giant's social media account replied to the same with a picture from the recent ICC T20 World Cup final, which was played between Indian and South Africa.

Article Title: Government suspends these two telemarketing companies over sending 5.5 million fraud SMSes
Article Text:
The duo sent over 5mn fraud SMSes since Jan, 2024, DoT claims

What the companies has to say about it?

Amid rising SMS frauds in the country, the department of telecommunications ( DoT ) has suspended operations of two telemarketing companies, namely V-con Intelligent Security and OneXtel Media, reports Economic Times. In its direction dated July 15, the telecom department said that the two misused their platform to send malicious and phishing SMSes, the report states.‚ÄúIn the interest of safeguarding the citizens from cybercrime/financial frauds, all the TSPs (telecom service providers) are directed to: immediately suspend these two RTMs (registered telemarketers )‚Ä¶(and) lodge police complaint against them for misusing DLT platform for sending malicious and phishing SMSes,‚Äù read the DoT direction.V-con - a part of the Videocon Group, and OneXtel Media were found responsible for sending 55.5 million fraudulent SMSes to smartphone users since January 2024. DoT‚Äôs action comes after receiving several complaints filed by telecom users on the Chakshu portal about malicious SMSes.Quoting officials involved in the investigations, the ET report states that the DoT ordered blacklisting of 131 principal entities (PEs), 5,000 SMS content templates, and 700 SMS headers. However, the fraud senders came up with new headers to cheat the blockchain-based SMS filtering system.The ET report says that it was also found that one among these two entities ‚Äì V-con and OneXtel ‚Äì had received money from bank accounts that were involved in multiple complaints of organised transnational crimes, including illegal stock investment frauds.As per the report, OneXtel has strongly opposed the government‚Äôs suspension on grounds that the company was not given any opportunity to present its case. Abrar Chunawala, chief executive of OneXtel Media said ‚ÄúWe are in cognizance of DoT‚Äôs order but also surprised on how the government has casted the burden on a reputed telemarketer like us operating since nine years. It must be noted that we were never intimated about the department‚Äôs action, no show-cause notice was served.‚Äù‚ÄúThe 55.5 million ballpark figure given in the order, presumably is for 6 months and belongs to two entities. Let‚Äôs assume 17 million of these were passed through Onextel. This represents only 0.06% of our total traffic. Is it then fair to suddenly put a company out of business for such a small percentage? As per regulation, it is the responsibility of telecom companies to operate the DLT system. Are they not at fault along with their DLT tech partners?‚Äù Chunawala added.
Article Summary: V-con Intelligent Security and OneXtel Media were found responsible for sending 55.5 million fraudulent SMSes to smartphone users since January 2024. DoT‚Äôs action comes after receiving several complaints filed by telecom users on the Chakshu portal about malicious SMSes.

Article Title: Ashneer Grover: What I have understood about hiring, but a lot of people don‚Äôt agree with this, is ...
Article Text:
Here‚Äôs what Ashneer Grover said on hiring

Ashneer Grover , founder of BharatPe and ex-Shark Tank judge recently sat for a podcast interview with YouTuber Ishan Sharma. During the interview, Grover shared his thoughts about the hiring process stating that he does not believe in lengthy hiring process and notice periods. He said that he believes in ‚Äò hire fast, fire fast ‚Äô rule.When asked about how he hires and manages people, Grover said that he has personally not experienced 100% success in hiring the right candidate.‚ÄúWhat I have basically understood about hiring, and a lot of people don‚Äôt agree with this thought, it‚Äôs hire fast, fire fast,‚Äù he said in the podcast.Explaining further, he added ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs happening currently is that you are investing a lot of time in hiring a person, you go through multiple rounds. The candidate is also, naturally, at his best behaviour. When a candidate comes to sell himself or pitch for himself, then the salesman in him is at its peak. At the end of the day, you will get to know whether he will work or not only after you give him his tasks,‚Äù.‚ÄúSometimes people are able to sell themselves very well. My realisation is this ‚Äì we spend 3 months identifying the ideal candidate, then the candidate serves his 2 months of notice period, so we wait for those 2 months. We, at this point, have already invested around 6 months into this role. Once the candidate joins, we want to give him the same amount of time to prove himself. So from 6 months, now it is 1 year.‚Äù‚ÄúAfter a year, you realise he is not a good fit. I think the best thing to do is to do local optimisation, you decide you need a candidate in a week-15 days, you get him in fast. Judge him on his work faster. And it is very simple to understand who works and who does not. So, hire fast and fire fast,‚Äù Grover said in the podcast.
Article Summary: BharatPe founder and ex-Shark Tank judge Ashneer Grover sat for a podcast interview with YouTuber Ishan Sharma. During the interview, Grover shared his thoughts about the hiring process stating that he does not believe in lengthy hiring process and notice periods.
